pages.text: For the third Experiment, we are going to work in the laboratory for the first time. In every laboratory there is a box where you can find DNA syringes. These also work using the right mouse button. With the DNA Syringe you can take blood from the chickens and examine it at the laboratory bench. More info see MENDELCRAFT GUIDE: The Laboratory: view DNA.

In this Experiment we will look for the gene responsible for the colour of a chicken's head. You do this by taking a blood sample from chicken 1, chicken 2 and chicken 3 and by examining and comparing it on the laboratory bench.
TIP: Pay close attention to the order of the syringes and do not forget to take them back from the laboratory bench after the analysis.
Look at chromosome 1 and find the differences in the genes and write down your findings. How is it possible that the combination of two genes donâ€™t result in a gray head color? Read explanation 2.
